oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dug relics from Stewart's Landing (now East Bluff) in Meigs County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: East Bluff was the site of several encampments by Confederate troops and witnessed a skirmish in August 1864 during Wheeler's Tennesee Raid. The relics include a candlestand, portions of a lantern, and artillery sharpnel from the engagement. The site also included several homes. The 5th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA under the command of Col. George Washington McKenzie was a local unit which also camped in the area.
